description:
Growth Hacking 101: How to Powerfully Jumpstart Your Business with the M.O.V.I.E. Model

Do you have a business or concept that you think is incredibly interesting—yet can’t find a way to move forward? Have you ever heard of growth hacking? What about dream hacking? (Don’t worry: we won’t “hack” your business or dream.J)

Join us for an evening of smart exchange, business chit-chat, strategizing and networking at AutoWorld. (This is a joint event I’m holding with another business networking group I lead)

Activity Group: Brussels Business Success Academy + InterNations Brussels Business Roundtable

Date: Thursday, December 12th, 2013

Place: AutoWorld

Time: 5:30 p.m. – 7:30 p.m.

Agenda:

Part I—Growth Hacking Presentation ǀ Q&A Session

Part II—Brainstorming and Discussion on Real-Life Business Cases (Submitted by Members)

Part III—Networking
how_to_find_us: Any question, please call me at 0485 992 521.
name: Growth Hacking 101: How to Jumpstart Your Business with the M.O.V.I.E Model

description:
You have a business or a business idea. You think your killer idea will revolutionize the entire industry…or, well, just maybe a section of it. You have a business plan.

You are happy…and excited.

And then comes the money problem. No bank wants to lend you money, and you can’t risk your personal savings in a new venture.

So you’re stuck. 

Wait a minute! You shouldn’t be stuck. Why drop a smart idea because of money problems.

Join us for a lively discussion about business funding—and let us review in detail 20 smart, affordable and easy ways to raise money for your company or project, without coping with the always dreaded “Application Denied” entrepreneurs receive from lenders.
how_to_find_us: ETHNIC Lounge Bar Avenue Louise, 277 1050 Ixelles
name: Bootstrapping & Crowdfunding: 20 Smart Tactics to Propel Your Business

description:
Believe it or not, the modern version of the good-old battle of the sexes is happening right now…right before our eyes...in the business world. But who’s winning the feud?

Who should you hire to run your business – a woman or a man?

Is Coca-Cola’s CEO Muhtar Kent better than his female counterpart at PepsiCo, Indra Nooyi? Is Larry Page – Google’s “whiz kid” and current boss – more adept than Yahoo! no-nonsense chief Marissa Mayer or Hewlett Packard’s Meg Whitman or IBM’s Virginia Rometty? Will General Motors new exec Mary Barra surpass her fellow leaders at, say, Toyota, BMW or Renault PSA? What do female execs bring to the table than male chiefs don’t? Is leadership inherently male-oriented or female-bound? Are men better leaders, naturally? What core qualities do you need to run an organization, a country, a team…or well…a family? So many questions, so many answers… for a hot debate!

Join us one more time for a vibrant, fun-filled and enriching conversation around gender and leadership – and what it takes to be the perfect manager in today’s global business environment.

Share your experiences with us, so we can all learn, grow, succeed and nurture each other.

This time we’ll tweak things around a little bit – so we will invite two executives (male AND female, you guessed it!) to help us lead the debate and stir things a little bit…Yeah, just a little bit! No battle of the sexes at this meetup. (We promise.)
name: Are Female Business Leaders Better Than Their Male Counterparts?

description:
Join us for a vivacious discussion on branding, business tactics and product strategy – and let’s study the anatomy of a cult brand, especially how leading brands, such as Apple, L’Oreal and Harley-Davidson, build fanatical followings and ludicrous loyalty.

This presentation is a condensed version of research we conducted recently, in which we studied the world’s most renowned brands to try and unlock the genetic code that has helped them dominate their markets and decimate their competitors for years. 

Learn the 10 essential elements that successful brands use to forge fanatical followings and win legions of loyal advocates.  

A must-attend event if you have a business or plan on starting one, and don’t want your brand strategy to falter from the get-go.
how_to_find_us: Boulevard St Michel 47  | 1040 Brussels - Belgium | subway: Montgomery & Boileau
name: 10 Smart Tactics to Make Customers Fall in Love with Your Brand

description:
Join us for a TED-like conference on startup planning and marketing at Solvay Brussels School of Economics and Management. An expert panel of 4-5 will lead the workshop, sharing insight on business strategy, sector analysis, brand positioning and marketing. A networking session is scheduled after the seminar.

Our Guest Speakers

Antonio Nieto-Rodriguez 
Author of “The Focused Organization," a comprehensive book on corporate strategy, Antonio Nieto-Rodriguez is an expert in strategy execution and project management. He is also a visiting professor in Solvay and Nyenrode Business Schools, where he teaches strategy execution and program management to MBA students. ([masked])

Rozina Spinnoy
Creative Director of Design2Style and qualified Interior Designer. D2S specializes in residential and commercial Interior Design, Brand Design and Project Management. Recent projects include the KONE Head Office in Brussels, and 'on-screen Designer' and Set-Designer for U.S. HGTV television channel design show ([masked])

Martin van Wunnik
Financial strategist for starters and SME’s at FinanceCoach24.com. He worked for several organizations, including Impulse Brussels, Sirris, Solvay Entrepreneurs and Microsoft Innovation Centre -- and is a member of the Brussels’ tech community Betagroup/Beta Coworking. Together with Xavier Corman he co-organizes events for his Finance for Startup’s community (400+ members) ([masked])


Marquis Codjia
Managing Director of MC&Co., a New York-based consultancy specialized in business strategy, public relations, competitive intelligence, marketing and employee coaching/training. Recently launched WordFusia, which provides writing and multimedia services to businesses, public figures, individuals and nonprofits. ([masked], [masked])

name: ULB Solvay Seminar: How to Plan, Launch and Market Your Startup

description:
*Free event open to everyone*

Join us in the finale of the 2014 TED-like Business Seminars series! Woven into this last conference are thought-provoking questions around career planning, professional networking, CV writing, HR management, employee attrition and job market dynamics.

>>> You’ll find this symposium helpful if you:

- Want to switch careers and need expert insight before making a decision

- Are unemployed

- Are a student unfamiliar with the job market

- Are a professional in the public or private sector

- Work for a supranational organization, such as the European Commission or NATO

- Are an entrepreneur unschooled in the intricacies of talent management

- Are an HR professional

- Are an employer seeking talented and productive candidates

>>> After attending this workshop, you will learn how to:

- Properly plan and manage your career

- Effectively switch careers at the right moment

- Write an impeccable CV and increase interview prospects

- Find and hire talented employees for your business

- Boost employee productivity and reduce attrition

- Engineer a successful professional-networking strategy

>>> Keynote speakers to be announced shortly.
